frame.name: Architectural_part
frame.definition:
<def-root>An entity is integrated into a building as a <fen>Part</fen> of a (possibly unexpressed) <fen>Whole</fen> which may refer to the whole building or merely to a sub-part of the building.
<ex>We need <fex name="Dsc">new</fex> <fex name="Part"><t>counters</t></fex> for the kitchen</ex>
<ex>The storm ripped off the <fex name="Whole">bathroom's</fex> <fex name="Part"><t>roof</t></fex></ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Part</fen> of a larger architectural unit, the <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex>Marty leaned against the <fex name="Part"><t>fireplace</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Whole
FE.definition:
<def-root>An architectural unit which includes the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="Whole">living-room</fex> <t>fireplace</t> is just for show.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>A property relating to the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>The building had a <fex name="Dsc">dilapidated</fex> <t>facade</t>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Orientation
FE.definition:
<def-root>This is a property of the <fen>Part</fen> that situates the <fen>Part</fen> within the <fen>Whole</fen>.
<ex>Looks like he fell through the <fex name="Orientation">side</fex> <t>wall</t>, innit?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Part</fen>, including components, ingredients, etc.
<ex>The house has a <fex name="Material">marble</fex> <t>floor</t></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The Individual who creates the <fen>Part</fen>.
<ex>If <fex name="Creator">a mason's</fex> <t>wall</t> collapses, is it always his fault?</ex> </def-root>
